header.title: AGEISM IN THE BEAUTY INDUSTRY: Stop Ignoring Women Over 40
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: I hope my message is clear-. we need more representation of all ages in beauty.. frugalistablog@gmail.com . . Over 40 YouTubers to check out:. . Uppiesbeads . https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjJE.... . Sugar Puff and Fluff. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUSV.... . Hip Chick Online. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoc5.... . Ms GoldGirl. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmdt.... . Angie Hot and Flashy. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCU9r.... . Monique Parent. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OrrUk.... . . . Here's my info:. email- frugalistablog@gmail.com. Twitter- https://twitter.com/frugieblog. Instagram- https://instagram.com/frugieblog/. Snapchat- frugieblog. blog- www.frugalistablog.com. FAQ-. How old am I? – 44. What kind of skin do I have? – Dry and very sensitive. What is my typical shade range?- MAC N20. Is blond my natural hair color?- Yes. Am I a mom?- Yes, I have a daughter and a son.. . . Discount codes and affiliate links-. http://www.ever-pretty.com/ code ‘frugalista' for 30% off. Vanity Planet 15 pc Brush Set- http://www.vpwow.com/blending. Use code BLENDING for 70% off. Vanity Planet- http://www.vpwow.com/frugalista enter FRUGALISTA for 70% off their site. http://sebamedusa.com/ use code FRUGAL20 for 20% off your order. https://www.artdecobeauty.com/ use code FRUGAL20 for 20% off your order. http://www.amazingcosmetics.com/ use code WITHLOVE for 20% off your order. AGOACYNC for 25% off store-wide DoColor Brushes.  https://www.amazon.com/Docolor-Pieces.... . Fanity Mirror- http://www.decobreeze.com/fanity-mirror/. $50 off with code FRUGAL50. . We Make Beauty- . http://www.wemakebeauty.com/?avad=183.... Use code- FRUGALISTA for a 15% off your entire order. . Ebates signup for cash back-. http://www.ebates.com/rf.do?referreri.... . Try Stitchfix- stitchfix.com/referral/3680793. Hi I'm Frugie, or Rebecca when I'm not on the Internet. I'm a makeup addict who loves to bring you the latest and greatest finds out there in all price categories. I'm over 40 so I hope to navigate the beauty world using a ‘mature lense'. But who am I kidding? I'm ridiculous and silly most of the time! It's makeup people. Let's not take it too seriously! Hope you enjoy my humor and my ‘keeping it real' attitude. I started this channel as an extension of my humor blog I write at sometimes- www.frugalistablog.com . Thanks for joining me in all this crazy fun!
header.socioLingVar: Age - General,Age - Over 65s,Gender - General,Age - Youngsters,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments

commentThread.commentText:
No Maled as Models.Boycott make up companies that use in ads.
Tell them to stop using males as models these are positions that could go to women and older women in general. I don't buy cosmetics from companies that use male models.
You are preaching to the choir. I think there is an even bigger market in the beauty industry for women over 40. I agree with you 100% and feel we should all be included.

New subscriber.  Risadoesmakeup also discussed this issue.  I am always looking for channels that also present products that work for/with mature skin.  If more mature women do not get the products to test or see the used successfully, how do we know what to get?
Thank you for the conversation.

I totally agree we need some more age diversity in Instagram and the rest of social and traditional media. Seeing teen after teen is boring as hell. I just started unsubscribing like crazy, and if I cant find anything worthwhile in instagram im going to uninstall that app. So many accounts are just sneak peeks of the main you tube channel, or a bunch of teen makeup pictures, like OMG create some frigging content for instagram or get off the frigging platform! Keep it fresh! Change it up every couple of weeks or months god. I like channels mostly from people close to m y age or older. My only gripe is people making boring as hell, irrelevant videos. I often want to see the information Hot and Flashy puts out there, but the pace, delivery, content and editing is boring as hell. Just can't. I just speed through her videos IF I watch them.
I'm 54 and couldn't agree more! I regularly watch several over 40 YouTubers! I have to say that I also have some younger favorites! A lot of the girls are so talented! Love It all!❤️
Well said! Completely agree!

Wait until you are in your 60s. We become invisable and some ppl think we are too old to be interested in make up. I like to look my best no matter my age and I spend a lot of money on make up but we are left out when they market.
I LOVE THIS. Ive been trying to get that message out myself.
Great, great video.  I am 64 and love makeup.  I watch you a lot but I don't comment often on YouTube videos.  I had to say something about this one, though.  You made some great points.

Yes! Yes! Yessssss!!!!  I searched "over 40 makeup" (I'm 42) because someone who is 20 doesn't have the same mature skin, lines etc. I wish that advertising would cater to us!  Thank you for all the reviews. I am so glad I found your channel!

replies.commentText: That makes me happy to hear! Thank you!

commentThread.commentText: I completely agree with you. Thank you for sending out this message and I hope that it gets heard by the people that can actually make a change. I recently began my own channel on you tube for women over 40 because of the limited channels available to us 40 something youtubers. I'm not a "make-up expert" and I feel I represent the average consumer. I would love to see big makeup companies giving us tips and advice on make-up trends and not only the ant-aging stuff. We can be hip beautiful women too!!

replies.commentText: I hope more people and cosmetic companies see the message too! Good luck on your channel! We need more 40 somethings around here. Cheers!
Thank you! 😉

commentThread.commentText: BRAVO!!! 👏👏👏
Amen sister!! 42 and proud!
older women have more money to spend

right now 666 thumps up. spooky!!!
 throw a little bit salt over ur shoulder :-)

I totally agree!!! But.....even when they book elder women for their antiaginproduct advertisng,they took a lot of good light for the photos and then photoshop and this is not ok too.I dont trust any of the advertising in anyway and all the promisses. Would like to see all the celebreties,You tuber,Blogger in the harsh daylight or neonlight and the good the make up supposed to be,it shows the whole mess. Imho! Greetings
PREACH
Amen!!!
Great video. I am 41 and understand your point of view

replies.commentText: Thank you so much!

commentThread.commentText: I agree with you. I see young girls say the foundation didn't settle into lines and I'm like, " What lines?"
Bravo! Good for you! Someone had to say it like it is!
Kendall Jenner in an Estee Lauder ad -- LOL

replies.commentText: One reason I support L'oreal/Lancome (though they're not my 100% favorite brand) is that they signed on Helen Mirren.

commentThread.commentText: i 100% agree with you I'm not in my forties yet but I just really would love more than anything to look up to more women in that age group doing what these younger girls are doing I'd rather have someone older like I said to look up to

replies.commentText: Thank you for watching!

commentThread.commentText: Amen thank you, but you hit it right on the spot.  I hope they watch this.  That's why I watch only utubers over 40.  Yeah like the young gals can talk about wrinkles, please give me a break.

I am just getting far enough into my career to have money to venture into places like Sephora to buy make-up. There is no way I could have afforded anything other than drugstore make-up. I do believe that drugstore stuff has come a long way and I still buy some brand (cruelty free). I really didn't know much about application and keeping up with trends and youtube has helped tremendously. I, in particular, like discussions around techniques and products that help with fine lines and wrinkles. I would love to see more youtubers my age or older. PS...I love that you support some indie brands as well.
Yes!!  So glad you made this video!  Couldn't agree more 😊

Right on sister! 
I love that you actually mentioned us over-40 peeps.
Great video. I completely agree.
YES!!! I wore very little make up in my 20's. I didn't start to understand how much fun it could be till much later in life.

replies.commentText: I feel like I'm having WAY more fun now than I did 20 years ago!

commentThread.commentText: Yes!  Thank you!  (48 here)
Thank you for this!! You are so on point!!

I had a 20 something ask me if I knew how to use my iPad. I asked him "do you know how old Steve Jobs was when he came up with the idea of all your technology". I hate it that at 54 the younger ppl think we don't know what we're doing or that they can't understand why we still want to look good. Can you tell you hit a nerve lol?

replies.commentText: Oh boy. Ahem. How cute of that person. Yeah, please don't underestimate us you youngsters! My mom is 75, has an iPad, an iPhone, texts, Facetimes, Tweets and is on Facebook. We don't stop interacting as we age!

commentThread.commentText: I'm 44 and just started wearing makeup again and watching YouTube to learn a bit about mature skin

I absolutely love this video! Thank you so much for speaking g for us! I am 43 years old and when I found your channel on here I was so happy to find someone my age! Don't get me wrong I love watching Jaclyn Hill but I can relate to you better! I was diagnosed with Melenoma this year and have some spots on my face. Well if I use heavy coverage concealer it cakes up on my dry skin. I have dry, sensitive, mature fine lines under my eyes and my smile lines. I want to have something to cover but not cake up for m y age skin! I am so glad you did this video!!! Thank you!!!

replies.commentText: Thank you for your comment! Good luck on your Melenoma, that is scary. We all need to be careful!

commentThread.commentText: Yes! Love this "request"! ❤️ Really well presented. Said everything I would love to say when I shop Lancôme or Chanel,lol.

I'm 33 and I love you tubers that are older because I can't relate to the Patrick/Jefree starr's of the world, not even the Jacqueline hills. What I love about watching women such as yourself are the great tips with skin care etc that I can put into place now and be ahead later on. I'm so tired of these filters that make you tubers look like they're not even real people. They put on a foundation and they look flawless like they did without the foundation. I like to see how these products are really working and not by people also trying to sell them to me. I have actually been meaning to ask you if you're planning on doing a retin-a update if you're still using it? That is something I started on about 3 months ago all because of the older you tubers and I'm so happy I did! You were one of the people that convinced me to try it out and living in Canada I don't pay a penny for it! I'd love to know how it's working for you. Continue your great work!

replies.commentText: Thank you so much for your comment! I'm only using Retin A about once a week. I want the benefits of it, but my skin texture changes and my foundation seems to slip off. But it builds collagen so I figure it's good to continue. I will do an update soon. I keep forgetting!

frugalistablog there are sooooo many amazing benefits from using retin a. I have done a lot of research as I had a really hard time adjusting to it and wanted to know exactly why I was putting myself through it. Lol. I know what you mean with foundation, but I use retin a 2 to 3 times a week and the days in between I use AHA exfoliants and hydrate like mad and it's working well. It's the absolute number 1 anti ager out there. I sound like an infomercial;) do you watch hot and flashy's channel? She's a wonderful mature beauty channel and she's had phenomenal results. She's also the kind of channel you're talking about, geared toward mature women going through menopause. I just love you gals!

commentThread.commentText: I wish there were more YT's in our demographic were making this kind of video.  So awesome for you to stand up and say what we are all feeling and want to demand of the beauty industry.  And I  wish we had more subscribers who would support the channels of women over 40.  It would boost the confidence for more women to have a beauty channel for older women.  Then we would have more resources and opinions to from which to choose.   I  am 45 and have some disposable income to spend on beauty products.   I rely on my YouTube channels to give me reviews and information before I make any purchasing decisions.  I love having you as one of my main channels for my go to information on beauty products.   You keep it real and entertaining at the same time. Thanks for everything you do!
Very well said!!

I'm 35 and I enjoy your channel very much.  I think it's just smart to watch the channels of beautiful over 40 women.   I think you have a fun, quirky personality.  I also prefer the channels that integrate high end and drug store brands.  Thank you and keep it up!!

Well said!  I agree with everything you said.  I, too, am over 40 and I watch your channel all the time because I can relate to you.  I have always loved makeup, but I find that as I have become older, my love for makeup has grown exponentially.  This is  precisely because of people like you, who represent me on YouTube, as a women over 40.  I appreciate you putting the message out there because it needs to be said.  Thank you!
Yes....Thank you, Thank you, Thank you! Totally agree with you! More women over 40 with different shapes!

Thank you for making this video! I'm 58, and feel ignored. Thank God for the over 40's, 50's & 60's channels. I love makeup and skin care. I don't wan't to have a 20 something tell me how to apply makeup, or what skin care to buy.

Thank you so much for the topic.  I am 59 and love make up.  However, I think there has been a lot of advancement in including all ages/races, etc. then when I was your age.  Just on the cover of Vogue (March '17) a plus size model is included.  I love seeing Lauren Hutton modeling again!  Yes, we still need more colors, sizes, etc. but it has improved.

Thank you!! you are absolutely right. I keep asking myself why young girls are the ones that are representing a product intended for woman our age. I don't buy it cause im pretty sure it would d o nothing for my aging skin.

Totally agree and even though I have a few years on you, I love skin care and makeup. If you look at my bathroom counter, I could be considered a makeup junkie! I also would pose that it is not frivolous pursuit. I actually do skincare and cosmetics classes for older women in my little corner of the world. I strongly believe it really helps women's self-confidence and self-esteem. It has become a real campaign for me. So, keep up the good fight, Rebecca! It isn't just about makeup!!

I don't agree at all when it comes to skin care. I know we live in different places. TV commercials for skincare has older women as their spokesperson. Covergirl changes their people up, but they still have older women. Maybe I'm missing something. I feel like we are represented when it comes to skincare, now makeup that's a different story, there is no makeup other than flower and pixi. Just my opinion.

BRAVO, BRAVO, BRAVO!!!! Holly and I have had our Over 40 YouTube channel for almost two years and have a painfully small following. I wish there was a way to target women over 40...but that's another topic. I also wish there was a stronger over 40 YouTube community where we can support other over 40 YouTubers. :( I hear ya about cosmetic companies and advertising. Don't they realize that older women have money to spend on beauty? Probably more than early 20 somethings? It irks me too when I see 17 year old GIRLS modeling for a anti-aging product. And don't even get me started about thin women modeling plus size fashion (my rage is real). Great video Rebecca!
I agree with you 100%! I'm 44, and am very interested in all kinds of beauty products. Thank you for putting this out there! PS. Your makeup looks flawless!
YAAASSSSS, PLEASE!!!! Stop showing 25 yr old models!!!!!! Use grown women!!! 40, 50, 60 yr old models!! We are a demographic that are ignored!!!

I'm 66, love makeup and totally agree with you! I go into a makeup store and I am disappointed so often by the young S.A. who seem know less about makeup application and products than what I do! How can I ask them for advice? They try to help but really just don't get it.
And we have the money to buy product! Preach on!

I love this video so much!! I too, am over 40 and have a YT channel, and feel your same frustations!!!! I'm so glad you brought this to the forefront and spoke freely about real issues today! I've watched you about a year and don't think have ever commented,   but felt compelled to give you a big high five for going out on this limb!! great job, Rebecca!!! Big fan! Have a great week! 😊
Love this. Love you. ❤️❤️❤️
Agreed I have been looking for new skincare products because I am over 40 and have not found a line that caters to those needs.
yes  yes yes
Oh my goodness I am so with you thank you for having that voice for all of us women over 40 we are just as beautiful and I love your channel and what you stand for once again thank you

Preach on, sistah, preach. We are also "over 40" and just started our YouTube channel two months ago because like you, we felt there was a gap, an unfilled need and just a flat out diss for women our age. We matter too, by golly! LOVE the Kendall Jenner line lol. - - xoxo, Cindy and Carla (2 Real Chicks)
yes! i'm 52 and have loved and worn make-up since i was in my teens. love your channel and opinions!
Excellent timely video! So very well stated. Thank you.
Geek Out of Water is another great over 40 youtuber! great video, Rebecca! us over 40 gals still love makeup!
Hear, hear!
Totally agree with this (35 here). Randomly, your undereye area looks fabulous!
Love this --& love you / your channel. ❤️️    Very on point with this. Thumbs up. 👍
Lisa Eldredge - I don't know how old she is but she isnt 20 either! She also works with Lancome!
Thank you from a 48 year old!!! 😘
Well said! I am over 40 & love makeup! Thank you!

I agree. One of the things I love about your channel is that you don't throw down rules for makeup for ladies over 40. I just turned 50...I discovered makeup in the last 10 years, I have way more spending money than I did in  my 20's and 30's (!) and I am building my makeup collection from the ground up.  I love to wear color and sparkle. I'm tired of being told that if I'm over 40 I can only wear certain types of makeup. Who is the makeup police anyway??!! Anyway, thanks for doing a great job and your message is a smart one:)

I am getting ready to turn 69 and I still love  wearing makeup and trying new things. You are so right in your thinking about the over 40 gals. There are still a lot of us out here that agree with you. Thanks for bringing it up. Maybe change will come.

I agree with you. It is always a 20 year old selling wrinkle cream. It is wonderful that companies are finally using models with different skin tones but you rarely see them use models of different ages or different body shapes and you rarely see Native American, Indian, or Asian models. It would be wonderful if ALL types of women were represented and if Benetton can do it, why can't makeup companies?
DITTO !!!!
This is everything!  Thank you!  😘👏👊
Amen, sister! I'm 50; LOVE makeup; and, have the $$ to spend......

Preach, sista! I'm 45 and looooooove makeup and skincare. I love to see what other women my age do and how it looks on them. I can get ideas from the younger generation but cannot relate to a lot of it because they don't have the fine lines or the hyper-pigmentation to deal with. Again, thank you so much for addressing the older elephant in the room😬
NULL

THANK YOU!! While I'm over 50, I don't really have the disposable income that some of your viewers do due to a series on unfortunate events which came one after the other(x 4).
      The income I do set aside for personal care, I'm careful with and would love to be as informed as the next person.I don't have the money for surgical interventions or Botox so I want to see more amazing skincare that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. I will splurge on one product, but want to be assured that it does work/will work with less pricier brands.
Just because they didn't go to college last year doesn't mean they don't know what lipstick is on trend. Brilliant sentence and very true. Thanks for this video. #38withthreekidsmarriedfor15years
Thank you sooooo much.  Just what I wanted to say!!  It's really true. We want to buy. Buy. Buy. But we only see 20 year olds on the ads.  Not realistic.  Need over 40 50 60.  !!!!!
thank you so much for getting the word out about us 40 something's

I hear you I have a small channel as well and I think women over forty think about this we have been using makeup much longer then the twenty somethings and we have seen how the makeup and skincare has evolved it irks me when I see someone get pr and then show it on snap chat and then that's it it goes into their pile of makeup instead of doing a video anytime I have received something I review it and give my honest thoughts I can't just say something is good because it was sent to me! That's not how I roll I always say what you see is what you get lol! Thank you for putting your message out there xox

I am 51 years old. THANK YOU!! It took me quite a bit of doing to find you and Angie and Tammy. There are a few more that I enjoy watching. I can not relate to the Nikkis or Jacklyns, nor do I want to at this time of my life. Thank you. You read my mind. your friend, Kristine
48, love makeup, and agree whole heartedly. I like the young girls' channels, but most of their videos aren't applicable to my life. I appreciate you and would like to find more people like us!
YOU ROCK!!!!

In 43 and totally agree! Sometimes I feel like an old bat watching the younger gurus, simply because that's what ppl think is ideal. Fortunately, there are tons of beautiful 40 something's out there and we deserve a chance to have our faces all over the beauty community as well;) All of you gorgeous you tubers over 40 are definitely my favorites to watch. I feel like I can relate more, but for some reason, these makeup companies aren't realizing how many of us there actually are!!!! Hopefully your video opens up some of their eyes and they pay attention to the fact that, we are all just women wanting to feel good about ourselves no matter how old we are!!!! Well said Rebecca, this is why I loveee your channel;)
Agree Agree Agree!!!!!  46 and your channel is my favorite!!

So much yes to all of your points. I'm not yet to 40-something, but I'm on my way like the rest who might still be in denial! ;) Some of us who've been married for, uh, lots of years and have an age-span of children relate better to an over 40 youtuber than a 20-something. We won't cease to be beauty enthusiasts just because we cross into a new decade. 
Maybe companies don't focus their marketing and products on the over-40 crowd because it's easy to make products that work on young skin. Add in skin concerns like fine or not so fine lines, large pores, undereye issues and all of the sudden that foundation isn't so fabulous anymore.

So much yes to all of your points. I'm not yet to 40-something, but I'm on my way like the rest who might still be in denial! ;) Some of us who've been married for, uh, lots of years and have an age-span of children relate better to an over 40 youtuber than a 20-something. We won't cease to be beauty enthusiasts just because we cross into a new decade. 
Maybe companies don't focus their marketing and products on the over-40 crowd because it's easy to make products that work on young skin. Add in skin concerns like fine or not so fine lines, large pores, undereye issues and all of the sudden that foundation isn't so fabulous anymore.

SERIOUSLY. I like seeing women my age on instagram and youtube. And I don't like to see women our age photoshopped to hell in advertisements. I wear more and buy more makeup now than I did when I was in my 20s. I'm not ashamed of m y age and I don't try to hide it and look 20. I'm happier than I've ever been. Makeup companies need to get with the picture.
I agree with you. I will be 40 this year, thank you so much for speaking up 😀

Gosh, I am 44 yo and I was looking for blushes at Ulta and the employee asked me if it was for my daughter... (it was a benefit blush palette, a couple of Christmases ago). My husband said that it was for me (I was too shocked to answer) and the employee says 'momma needs makeup too'...
so good and so professional ...your awesome
so good and so professional ...your awesome

replies.commentText: Thank you!

commentThread.commentText: Thank you! I'm 47 and I have to dig so hard just to find someone out there that does beauty for older ladies. I hope they are listening!

replies.commentText: I appreciate it. I hope so too.

commentThread.commentText: I'm 51 and just discovered beauty youtubers. I have rediscovered my love of makeup and skincare. I hope beauty companies rediscover us! I have some money to spend 😀

replies.commentText: That's right!! They need to pay attention. Thanks for watching!

commentThread.commentText: Im 53 and totally agree...but not only advertisement ...I think they need to do more research on products for maturing skin. Come up with foundations and concealers that REALLY cover wrinkles, dark circles, age spots..not just claim to and then when you get them home your under eye area looks worse than using nothing and your foundation has settled into all your lines and wrinkles not to mention polk a dot pores! Whew! Ok that rant is over.. Thanks Rebecca, I really do appreciate your channel! - Kristin ;)

replies.commentText: Hear hear!! Rant away. I'm with you. xoxo

commentThread.commentText: 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 Yes! I agree! Kendall Jenner is beautiful but that is not going to make me believe that is what she needs to use! Also I have more income to spend on makeup than I did when I was younger! Amazing message. Maybe older you tubers could collab more often so we could find out about them! Thank you!

replies.commentText: Thank you for watching! I would love to collab with those gals.

commentThread.commentText: Love
Love you're lip color. What's the brand and color? Xoxo roseingeorgia

replies.commentText: Thank you. It's the Wet n Wild catsuit liquid lip. It's in my Full Face Wet n Wild video.

commentThread.commentText: Amen. From a 64 year old I thank you so much for this video!!! xoxo
Thank You! It's about damn time! ❤

I'm definitely over 40 but I enjoy relating to all age groups. I don't think there's a shortage of representation for the over 40 group at all. I rely on many forms of advertisements; I honestly don't think there's a shortage of beauty bloggers over 40.
Agree 110%! We deserve to be heard! We spend a lot of money on products!

replies.commentText: Yeah we do!! Amen!

commentThread.commentText: Omg I put a comment on & lost it ,dead battery 😳Ok so Rebecca your right of course, I'm quite new to YouTube, at first I was watching Kathleen Lights etc she beautiful & I found makeup geek through her, I'd never heard of it on this side of the pond. I then branched out & I found you 🌸also Angie hot n flashy , Wayne Goss , StephanieMarie & Nadine Baggot . I realised I had no skin routine, well because when I was younger I'd put moisturiser on & the next day be full of spots lol & I realise we have different skin but I trust in what you say & if something doesn't work it's because i could be more sensitive although you are too lol . What I'm trying to say is you are funny, you give honest reviews & I suppose we will be having similar aches & pains, generally everything heading south lol & we can laugh about it & sometimes we can be sad too it's ok. Well done with your channel I hope it grows from strength to strength my picture might change but I will always watch you 👍🌸xx

replies.commentText: Thank you so much for your comment and following my channel. That is true. We need to laugh together as it all heads south! xx

commentThread.commentText: Go girl! Well said!

Yes! Yes! A thousand times, YES! I spend a lot of my hard earned money on make-up. I want to see it on someone closer to my age. I end up returning things because the products only look flawless on 20 year old skin. This is why I love your channel! Thank you!

replies.commentText: Thank you always for your support! xoxo

commentThread.commentText: Excellent message!! Because the cosmetics companies just don't care and ignore you tubers if they are not jonger or have millions of followers wich is very bad because everyone deserve that companies understand that are more people of different ages out there, and why not give the change to  you tubers over  30 or 40 or 50 or 60 as well!!!!

AMEN!!! I just turned 40, I am established in a career, I make very good money, and more importantly to makeup companies, I spend a shit load of money on makeup and skincare. I'm platinum at Ulta, rouge at Sephora and a Beautylish VIP. I've been those things for years and years. I have the extra money to spend, I'm a member of a very profitable demographic. Seeing 18-24 year olds in anti-aging skin care adverts bugs the ever living crap out of me too. I love make up. Let me stress, I LOVE makeup, but what works for a 18-28 year old isn't necessarily going to work for me anymore. I would love to see brands with multi-generational models so you can see what one product looks like on people of every age.

replies.commentText: Right? Yes! So glad you get it. And I love your enthusiasm too. It would be a win-win for all if we had more representation. We're basically saying 'here take our money!'

commentThread.commentText: Thanks hun for being the voice to thousands of women. I am 46 and I still love makeup just as much today as I did as a teen. So, with that being said one of the biggest things that I feel the more mature woman wants and looks for are products the same as what weve always been in to, only now we look for the products that look, feel and are better for our skin as w e age. Products that are maybe geared towards the matu re woman, instead of products that are more categorized for ev ery woman. Ya know?! Anyway, our interests as the more ma ture woman change as well. Such as the colors that catch our attention and so forth. Anyway, thank you for your channel and thank you for being the voice to be heard...see ya next time!!! xoxo <3

replies.commentText: Thank you! I really appreciate your comment. xoxo

commentThread.commentText: Amen
Yay!! So proud of you for putting this up!! We need a voice! I hope to start my channel soon

replies.commentText: Go for it!

commentThread.commentText: Thanks! I love watching makeup volgs for 40 and older, cause for one I'm in that group, and two skin changes,and color and how to put it on the older face is different!
Thanks so much for this video. Love your videos

OMG thank you for this video! I am 52 and I love love my make up but there young skin has nothing on mine. I louvre the young you tubers they are so talented and their make up is stunning on their beautiful young taught skin. But that same make up will never look the same on my crepe puffy eyes and parched skin, But I do the best I can with what I have. I still love to play with different looks and like to stay on trend as much as I possibly can and will still look good on me. Also don't these companies understand that we are already established woman with more money to spend especially on high end products. If you look at the comments on a lot of the young influences they are complaints of the YouTuber not using more drug store/inexpensive products. Obviously young ladies just starting out in life with smaller budgets to spend on make up. Thanks again!!!!

replies.commentText: You are so right! The younger channels comment section can be so negative. And they always want the drugstore stuff. Which I do too! But I definitely want something worth my money too. Thank you for relating to me!

commentThread.commentText: 🙌🏼43 here! I am so very happy you have done this video. Wake up people, we matter. We are still beautiful, desirable, lovely, important. Help us put our best foot forward, our best face even. Men our age have focus in so many areas in media. And damn it, if I have to see one more ED video...........

replies.commentText: HAHAHA! That's right!! And don't just stick us 40 and 50 year olds in bladder commercials!

commentThread.commentText: Love your videos, love your attitude, love you :)

replies.commentText: Thank you so much! Love you too!

commentThread.commentText: thank you so much!!!!   they are missing out on an untapped resource,,,,,big time!!!!!!

replies.commentText: I am 49 and I love to watch you,,,,,also because you are yourself,,,, nothing irritates me more than these young tubers or others that have clearly had work done,,,,going on about skincare...thank you again....
You're welcome. Thank you. I will always try to stay my old and natural self, I promise!

commentThread.commentText: YES!!!!!!! Thank you for this video. I'm an over 40 makeup junkie and I couldn't agree more!!! Cater to us too cosmetic companies lol. I have a lot of money to spend. Makeup is my passion and I need age appropriate cosmetics.

replies.commentText: I feel like based on the comments we all need to get those companies to listen to us! We want to be heard. Thanks for chiming in and watching! oxox

commentThread.commentText: I know it is hard to find products that are targeted toward me, I'm 45.  Thank u for speaking up for us all.   I love watching older YouTubers. .
👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼 as a 42 year old >woman I approve this message! I watch you BECAUSE you're m y age! Love you Rebecca!

replies.commentText: Muwah! Thank you! xoxo

commentThread.commentText: Yes, you tell them Sista! I stand with you, I primarily follow over 40 beauty you tubers! Much love and respect!

replies.commentText: Love back! oxox

commentThread.commentText: I'm 50, I buy products for myself, my children and my grandchildren.

replies.commentText: Well they're very lucky! I wish my grandma bought me makeup back in the day. Thanks for watching!

commentThread.commentText: Right on! I am 78 and trade makeup, magazines and tips with my grand daughter. I am active in my community, volunteer, and like to flirt with my husband. (We are about to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary.) Michele Obama, Cecile Richards and Annette Bening knock my socks off. I love your willingness to experiment, your sense of humor and your honesty. Best.

replies.commentText: Rock on!! Those women knock my socks off too! Congrats on 50 years of wedded bliss!

commentThread.commentText: I agree with you, as my kids get older, I get more free time. I love to watch videos. On snapchat it is crazy the amount of makeup and skincare that large channels are sent. I mean a new foundation launch in every shade.

I am so very glad you made this video. I love make up and all things beauty related and have since I was 14! So much so that is was my profession for years( licensed cosmetologist). Now as a women of 51 that has not changed. So thank you for speaking out for us all! I love your channel- keep up the GREAT work!

Great video... I'm 62 and love everything hair and makeup.  I also don't think we are represented in Sephora or Ulta!  We need older women working at these stores who can relate to our issues.  Thanks for posting this.  I hope they hear us!!

replies.commentText: Mary Salhanick amen!! I'd rather go into Nordstrom for that reason.

I'm always surprised at your age when I see your thumbnail Mary! You look 35! To be honest, maybe older women don't work at Sephora, because gosh darn retail sucks! :) LOL! But yep, I think they need to work on their marketing too. The amount of Platinum and VIB Rouge customers in those places are a huge chunk I bet. Thanks for your support!

commentThread.commentText: I think the subscribers are engaged with the mature beauty guru's but here is the main issue.... YouTube is not a platform for 40+.  The main demographic for YouTube would be I'm guessing 13-25.  So your audience right there is limited.  That will change though!  You lot will be the pioneers and the hard work will pay off.  I'm certain.

replies.commentText: I hope so! And yes, it is a Catch 22. But I think with the more attention made to our age group in this industry- the more our audiences will grow. At least that's my plan!

commentThread.commentText: Right on girl!!! 5os Rock! We have more money to spend but are turned off by beauty and skincare brands that use babies to sell wrinkle cream and skin peels. It's ridiculous! They don't seem to understand their market well enough to know what annoys us.

replies.commentText: Amen to that.

commentThread.commentText: THANK YOU! I'm 46 and lovin' it, but I feel completely ignored by cosmetics companies.

I saw that Kendall Jenner ad for EL advance night repair and I burst out laughing!! It's so irritating that if you're over 40, you're lumped into a "mature" category? I'm 41- not 21 or 71! Thank you for this video!! I agree with you 1000%!!
hi & thankyou  so much .Totally agree !!

I agree 1000%. I too, am sick of a 15 yo model promoting a product to hike bags under eyes and wrinkles. Well of course her face looks good in the product. SHES TOO YOUNG TO HAVE EYE BAGS AND WRINKLES. Cosmetic companies think we're stuppid, so in return, I buy a lot of makeup invented by makeup artists, so their bank gets my cash not the multi gazillionaire businesses

Yes yes yes! I'm over 50 and I've unfollowed the big time young Youtubers because I just can't relate.  Your videos are what I enjoy, because you're light hearted and REAL! Refreshing in the YouTube world 😊 
Thanks for posting this...I hope you get someone's attention
Right on Rebecca.....I'm 61 and I've been wearing a full face of makeup every day since I was 14 years old! I have always felt mature women are underrepresented in fashion and beauty!
May your message be heard loud and clear!  I couldn't agree more...

Rebecca, I'm 45 and I totally get it! Seriously, when I was 20 I didn't have the income I have now.  I am willing to spend money on good skincare and mkup. Cosmetic companies have a huge market they can tap into...and are barely skimming the surface.  I ONLY buy products that my 40 and over youtubers recommend. You'r terrific! thx for all your great content :)

Thank you so much, Rebecca!! I am 52 and have spent the last 21 years as a mom, housewife, and being totally devoted to running my household while working part time. But before that I was a single twenty something with a career. So why am I not relevant now?? These beauty companies are ignorant of the true value of women my age, and hopefully someday that will change. My value is just as great as it was when I was in my twenties, even greater, in my opinion, because of all the life experiences I have had. Thank you for speaking out!!!

Thank you so much for doing this video and being so honest. I really love your channel and I love your approach to beauty. And as I get older I find myself looking to women who are more mature for beauty advice. And when I found your channel I was excited. So thank you for making great videos. #sendingpositivevibesyourway✨🌞💛

great video. Cosmetic companies really need to place more focus on women over 40,we don't suddenly evaporate into thin air. we generally have more disposal income than younger women and are willing to spend it on the things we like,that appeal to us. I am happy you put. this out. I hope the cosmetic companies are watching and take note.
thank you for addressing this. I hope "they" listen
Yes, relate is the word! 👍👍
I would love to see you and Angie from hot and flashy in some  awesome advertising. When I go to buy I look up both of you for a guide because I don't question your integrity.
I love your channel and wish you many more subscribers.

I agree! I'm 50 and it is hard to relate to the 20 something youtubers. There are only a handful of influences in my age range and that is fine but I'd like to see more. I've watched your channel from very early on and love it! Thanks for all you do! 💜 from San Francisco

Aboaultely spot on! I am 53 and if I have to watch one more 20-something Youtuber showing us how to cover dark circles and undereye bags when they don't actually have any, I could scream! That's not to say that 20 somethings can't have undereye problems, it's just that most of the younger YouTubers are gorgeous and have perfect skin! I have searched and searched and have discovered several channels which speak to me, uppiesbeads59, Angie at Hot and Flashy and yourself of course, but these beauty companies really need to get on board - we need to be sold makeup that works for us and not just have the anti- ageing element pushed down our throats, ageing is a privilege not a disability!
Love, love the video! You are so right. There are a lot of us over 40 who love makeup and buy make up. We would love to see more women of our age being represented! Makeup companies need to wake up!
You go girl I'm 43 and I'm a makeup fanatic . And who do you think have more money to spend makeup  companies. Thank you for putting this out there. 😊

Amen sister! I started my channel for that reason, but then I got very discouraged because I felt no one wants to watch someone over 45 putting the makeup on! And when I go to Sephora or Ulta, those young girls have no clue how to address my concerns. Love your channel! xoxo
Word. Preach it. (53 here) Anti-aging or "repair" type products that use infants as models are a joke.

Preach it!! We spend a lot of money on makeup. I'm constantly searching for foundation to love. I like seeing how products work for others but I cannot take the opinion of 20-somethings looking for full coverage foundation seriously.
Thank you
I was just thinking about this a few days ago. I am so glad you did this video!!!!
Well spoken young lady!!!!
Brava Rebecca,  brava!! 👏🏻👏🏻 I'm 64, love makeup, wonder where YouTube was when I was in my teens and I LOVE ❤️ you and your channel ❤❤

replies.commentText: Yes yes yes yes

commentThread.commentText: Thank you and Amen! I'm 60 and I love to wear makeup. I enjoy watching some of the younger women to get a sense of how the new products perform,or what might be a dupe...but there are very few cosmetic companies that even acknowledge the woman over 40 (let alone over 50 or God forbid 60).
Thank you for this! I 100% agree!
Very well said.  Thanks for addressing this issue and being a voice for us.

You are so right! I started watching YouTube because my skin changes due to aging and menopause left me searching for ways to make my skin look better. I would also like to point out that women 40+ usually have more disposable income to spend on makeup and skincare. Maybe someone will pay attention.

Those millions ( in every country) of over 40 woman also have the money to buy stuff if those companies would just get with the program.I have asked Youtube for YEARS to make a directory so we could easily find woman creators over 40. No luck.

You hit it spot on! I would much prefer to watch a beauty blogger who is around my age because we have similar concerns and I can relate more to them. I've been trying to find more channels that I can relate to. I'm glad you brought this subject up because it does feel like we are being overlooked in the makeup industry. Hopefully someone from a makeup company will see this and cause them to think for a minute!!
Loved, loved, loved Kate Winslet in the Lancôme add!!!!

I applaud your efforts to speak out on our behalf. I have wondered if more women in the older age range would buy more makeup if it was easier to find products that really look good on different varieties of more mature skin. I sense that cosmetics companies are pandering now to consumers who just buy more and more, regardless of the quality of the product. Like the disappointing holiday stuff that fewer and fewer seem to appreciate. I'm very selective in what I will buy, but I will put out the money for an excellent, effective product. Thanks again for speaking up!!

I so appreciate all the work you put in to informing us about products, how they perform, and what is new and worth trying, & your awesome personality. There is nothing so frustrating than getting suckered into buying things that don't work. The problems we had in our teens & twenty's compared to now is a whole different ball game. Thanks Frug!

Preach on sister! I deliberately look for the older You Tube Video personality who is closers to my age who can instructions me about which makeup products works best for the more mature skin. Maybe the product industry will become as wise as we hope to be. Thank you for posting!!!
preach it, girl!!!!!!!!
and we are the ones that, in a lot of cases, really  have the money to spend--and want to!!!!
thank you thank you! the Kendall Jenner comment was spot on and I have the exact same reaction.
Yassss!!! I am 42 and I am so glad you posted this. Soooooo true!!!! I love your videos because you are honest. We sooo need more representation. Thank you, thank you!!!

Well... as long as we allow the whole beauty industry to tell us we need to "anti-age" (which is of course impossible) ... that we are not allowed to grow old this is not surprising that it's like this !!!
We need to share this video.... 💓💓💓

I'm almost 39 and I so agree!!!!!!! It's very hard to relate sometimes and I APPRECIATE more mature youtubers, their opinions, tutorials and keeping it real for women our age. I'm loving your channel I'm a newer subscriber....
I rarely get sent anything from the big makeup companies like Too Faced, Smashbox, Becca, etc. They would rather send PR to an 18 yr old youtuber rather than someone over 50.

Rebecca, sista, you go! It's so true, that we have these younger Youtubers who give us their opinion as to whether they think something might work with "more mature" skin or "older skin. I appreciate them trying to 'guess' but they truly have no idea because they don't have the life experience and their skin hasn't changed due to years earned, ha. Your humour and your enjoyment of makeup and skin care without taking it too seriously, is always welcome and appreciated! Your videos are always on my top to watch list...okay, maybe because I live through your addiction to eye palettes, but I digress....I'm sitting here at 51 y ears old and still trying to find that consistently reliable concealer, ha! Moi from Canada. Hugs to you for your raising awareness to us with "skin experience", ha!

commentThread.user: Long Story Short with Megan & Wendy
commentThread.commentText: Amen! You know we totally support this message!

Yes!!!!!! I am 41 and I spend on makeup like a mad woman. And I was happy to find you who is like me and loves makeup. There is not enough of us. I watch the young ones and I'm like what!! That can't work on me ( winged liner for ex) my skin is soft and creepy LOL. Thank you thank you thank you
Amen!! I hope somebody listens!!

Just a 62 year old subscriber here throwing in my two cents. First, love your videos and your message. Second, I love women supporting women and I think we can always learn from each other, regardless of age, and that's reflected in the variety of different ages of women whose channels I support. I understand why a company puts a 20 yea r old in their ads, but that doesn't mean that I'm not smart enough to recognize it and be insulted by it. I hope the cosmetics and skincare industry hear us, and meanwhile intend to show support in as meaningful way as is available to me.
So true! I'm 25 and most of the big youtubers that get attention are even younger than that! It's something brands really need to work on!

I am 45 and on one hand i would love to see you as a model for ad campaigns but on the other hand I love the woman you are so much I would probably buy everything you were on and that would not be good for the pocket book. lol. you are an amazing woman and I could watch you all day.
Yes! 50 here and outspend the 20 somethings exponentially on skincare and beauty (older often  = more disposable income).
Usually, we have more money to spend too!  Men still run the cosmetic companies, and there is a definite bias there.

You are so right on the money! I'm 51 and I love makeup and skincare more than ever because I have more issues to deal with now. I also have more money finally to spend on it but I don't want all that crazy luxury makeup that's filled with perfume and other crap that aggravates my extremely sensitive skin. I would also like to see the popular eyeshadow pallets being presented in a more daytime application instead of all this heavy, crazy stuff that you can't wear anywhere but to the club that all the young Youtubers do. I love watching your channel because you are so down to Earth and you relate to us in a real way. Keep up the great work!
Thank you for this message. You are so right. Love from France
Amen, Sister!!! Not only do we want to buy products; but, we have the money to do so!

I'm 42 and a stay at home mom. I feel like everything geared toward my age are always super expensive and high end. Even the drugstore products that are anti-aging are expensive. I'm a makeup and skin care junkie and I do feel like the over 40 group are ignored. Thank you for speaking up for us!! You are amazing and my fave youtuber!
oops...hit the wrong button. Why don't the cosmetic companies realize that mature, aging women have money to spend - probably more than someone just entering adult hood.
Great video!  Angie Hot and Flashy hates everything tho.  She depresses me😉

You are so RIGHT!  That's why we started our little corner of Youtube, the gap is HUGE and  we are largely ignored and yet probably are the biggest spenders in this area.  I really appreciate your content and just keeping it real.  We are totally 100% behind you!
I agree with you. I'm 50 and love beauty related items, especially skin care and makeup. Why don't the co

I loved this video.  I am 43 and and I find it very hard to relate to women on here in regards to make up.  Most of the women are in their 20's and I'm looking for a foundation that doesn't go into fine lines.  I'm looking for skin care that will help my skin to repair and look good.  I don't know many 20 somethings that have real skin care concerns.  So THANK YOU for this video.  XO

Thank you so much for posting this video! I am 60 and still working.I wear makeup almost every day. Don't the beauty companies realize that women over 40 probably have more money to spend on makeup? I hope all those over 40 give you thousands of thumbs up! Oxox

replies.commentText: Chris Rodriguez  ditto

commentThread.commentText: And, generally speaking, those of us over 40 or 50 have more disposable income :D  Thank you so much for making this.  I was thinking about you last night as I shopped in the It section at Ulta!
Yes!!!!
I'm a WOC and over 40 love your channel....I absolutely agree with you and hopefully one of these brands will consider you!!!
Well said!

I always thinks it's funny when commercials for anti aging products have 20 year old models and say how great their products are for fine lines and wrinkles. Like if I use their product I will look 20. And I'm thinking, that 20 year old doesn't even have fine lines and wrinkles.

Great video I hope this reaches the right people and we see a difference. I'm almost 40 and while I watch younger youtubers I would love to see more mature ones recognized. Great job Rebecca!!! Love ❤️ ya 😀

PREACH, girlfriend! I'm 41, and I am still, years after getting in to YouTube, appalled at how few of us there are represented here.  There ARE millions of us.  We are NOT a minority, and the irony is that we're actually the "consumers" they should be trying to cater to, because we're in the stages of our life in which we not only have greater need for more intensive (read "expensive") products, but we're also able to afford them due to our career stages.
Oh but to dream! Wouldn't it be so nice to see make up companies working with women my age to share and promote products! We are here and more often than not have more money to spend. Great video!
Preach it sister!!! I love your channel and many other youtubers 40 plus because I know you have real life and skin struggles just like I do. You are beautiful and so fun to watch!!!

Agreed!! I'll be 38 this year and it's hard to find tutorials/ads/makeup that can help me with how to apply makeup etc as my skin changes. I love your channel ... it proves beauty transcends all ages and just because we get older doesn't mean we can represent just as well as a 20 year old. Thank you for all your helpful and inspiring work ❤😊

PREACH!! Im 42 and I have far more discretionary income than I did at 25, I don't understand why the suits don't do the math, completely dumb, and yeah an 18 year old in an anti-aging ad is in NO way aspirational to me, it just makes me laugh. Love this Rebecca 😍🙏🙏😊
I think if you show more diy's it might get their attention; as it can reflect their bottom line.

Thank you for this message. I agree with you.   I'm 48 and I have just started getting back into makeup. I have spent so much money on products that don't work for my skin type. My foundation has been a nightmare because of having combo skin and large pores. Eyeshadow has been a challenge also.  Not all of us can wear a shimmer on our lids. Thank you for you videos. I enjoy watching them and I do take away some good tips and tricks.

I couldn't agree more! Companies, aim a product at the mature woman and then use a YOUNGSTER to try to sell it to us! It's downright insulting! Maybe we over 40, (50) should all make a video like this and perhaps they will listen to our numbers! :D xoxoxo

I hope your message gets to the cosmetic companies. I'm probably dreaming here, but I would love to be able to walk into Sephora and Ulta to a special section featuring new, quality make up and skin care products that cater to older consumers where I could zero in on a selection of nutrient rich foundations, eye palettes without glitter, moisture rich face, eye and lip formulas etc. I think cosmetic companies are missing a huge opportunity to zero in on a large and 'spendy' as you say, mature demographic. BTW, I am 60 and I love your videos. Even though you are not m y age, skin tone, skin type, you are so candid and honest and I love that you cover so many drug store, affordable products. Thanks for speaking out and please keep doing what you're doing. I think you're terrific!

Thank you! You and I are the same age and, I too, have teenagers. I did not become interested in beauty and makeup until my early forties. My kids were growing up and I had more time to research, learn, shop and experiment with makeup. Often, women in their forties finally feel more established emotionally and financially and are more willing to spend on beauty products. Makeup companies are ovelooking this.
I'm 29, and I'm so 100% in agreement with you! We will all be in older age groups sooner or later (if we're lucky). I love watching your channel and hope to be as awesome as you are in ten years.

This is the exact reason I started my channel and I've spoken about this as well.  Thank you so much for making this video and getting it out there!!  You are so right and I really hope that companies will start listening.  I love your channel and can definitely relate to the more mature but still LOTS of fun YouTubers.❤❤❤❤❤

replies.commentText: EXACTLY!!!  My sister and I started a channel for the same reason too. :) Oh...and we just subscribed to you.

commentThread.commentText:
Yes! Thank you for this video. I am over 60 and am judicious in my spending. Makeup and skin care are expensive and I want the best I can afford. I do spend much more money now than I did 20 years ago. Cruelty free and fully researched products are important to me. So many of us don't feel represented on YouTube or at the beauty counter. No 7 from the UK uses models that are not 15. Or 16. Haha. 
We need to remember to let our dollars speak for us. Buy products that are living up to our expectations. 
Peace and love ❤️
I agree with you 100%

Im over 50 and I am in total agreement with you. I realize the cosmetic companies are geared to the younger crowd, but we are still around and the 20 somethings will also one day be our age (and older) and still purchasing makeup.

I just recently started watching you tube makeup videos @41 and the only reason was because I wanted anti aging skin care advice and makeup for aging skin. Angie @hot and Flashy was the first and love her. I've started branching out a bit more and I'm trying to try a little harder with my makeup. The younger you tubers I've found drive me crazy 😂 I watch a couple but stick with older gals.

replies.commentText: Hi Angel. We couldn't agree more...which is why my sister and I started our own Over 40 channel. :) We love Angie too!

Angie has branched into having cosmetic procedures so she's stopped being relevant for me. I am 52 and found her, cuz I wanted to see older skin dealing with the cosmetics issues we have. I love Rebecca, sassy, humorous, and honest.
Agree. I can't relate because I'm her age and look so much older.

commentThread.commentText: I agree with you and you did this tastefully. -Maria

I agree with you 100%,!!! We can use some of the same makeup as the younger ladies, but it doesn't even apply on me like it does them. I'm 52, I would love to see more makeup and skin care video's that relate to how I would do things that fit my age. If the person i'm watching isn't at least 40 it really isn't relevant to how it would preform on me. I get tickled when I'm watching a video and they talk about a product settling into their wrinkles and they might be 20-30 years old. I truly hope you get a good response from this video...BTW, I love your video's, I've been watching for a long time and I love your website. Thank you, for speaking up about women over 40!!
I could not agree more!
agree! p.s. you look gorgeous in this video
I'm not over 40 but i will be one day and i want to know that there are companies that will be out there for me.

YES! We make up (no pun intended ) a big part of the population buying beauty products!  I can't understand why they do this? Do they think that seeing all those young ladies is going to make us buy their products?

Brava! You are so right. A pet peeve of mine is that companies target the more mature women with a plethora of luxury products and products for dry to very dry skin. Gr.... Not all women over 40 have money to burn (maybe they just assume we are desperate enough to buy outrageously priced products)  and not all mature women have very dry skin! 
Thanks for this video. Cheers!

Good video! I don't even watch you tubers like Nikki Tutorials anymore and have unsubbed because her videos are filtered and she doesn't look like that at ALL and it's too depressing when you start to compare yourself to a fake image at my age. It's so hard to find products that look nice on my older pore filled skin.
Thanks for this message. I so agree and love seeing someone my age.
Great video, !!!!
Thank you so much! I am also 42 and I don't feel represented out there when it comes to cosmetics. We are the biggest consumer.

Yes! I'm 42 and love makeup and skincare and I feel like unless it's anti-aging then I, as a consumer, am almost always ignored. I appreciate  Youtubers who are over 40 because they have similar concerns to mine and can speak more closely to my needs.

replies.commentText: Amen to that! It's as if we don't wear makeup. Thanks for your comment!
Thank you so much for this wisdom!
frugalistablog  ditto

commentThread.commentText: I here you. I'm part of a group called MAB Middle Age Beauties and that is exactly what we want. So thank you!!!

replies.commentText: Helping to spread the word. Thank you!

commentThread.commentText: amen and thank you. tired of beauty companies pushing anti- aging products on us with 20 year old models

replies.commentText: Same. Thank you for watching!

commentThread.commentText: You go girl Im 47 and very much into makeup it's about time us older ladies were listened to  hope you get somewhere with this and the cosmetic industry sit up and listen

replies.commentText: Yep! Let's make some noise! Thanks for watching.

commentThread.commentText: Yes Yes Yes! Keep representing!

replies.commentText: You got it!
Love you too! Thank you!

commentThread.commentText: Preach girl!

replies.commentText: oxox

commentThread.commentText: I haven't watched the video yet but I LOVE the title.
You go girl! I'm 43 and have limited resources on YouTube. ❤ you and keep the message moving

replies.commentText: Thank you so much for watching!!
Norma Salamy agreed!

commentThread.commentText: Yessssss
I hope you are listened to. I am 61 and still very much into makeup!

replies.commentText: Thank you, I hope so too!
